    <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-bff0a9b elementor-section-content-bottom elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="bff0a9b">
     <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">
      <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-33 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-449c8d2" data-element_type="column" data-id="449c8d2">
       <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
        <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-470bf2a elementor-view-default elementor-position-top elementor-mobile-position-top elementor-widget elementor-widget-icon-box" data-element_type="widget" data-id="470bf2a" data-widget_type="icon-box.default">
         <div class="elementor-widget-container">
          <div class="elementor-icon-box-wrapper">
           <div class="elementor-icon-box-icon">
            <span class="elementor-icon elementor-animation-">
             <i aria-hidden="true" class="far fa-eye">
             </i>
            </span>
           </div>
           <div class="elementor-icon-box-content">
            <h3 class="elementor-icon-box-title">
             <span>
              OVERVIEW
             </span>
            </h3>
            <p class="elementor-icon-box-description">
             <p style="text-align: justify;">
              SEAS 4.0 is a 90 ECTS integrated, international, innovative, and methodologically diversified course to award a double Master Degree.
             </p>
             <p style="text-align: justify;">
              It is taught in English and developed by the University of Napoli Federico II, University of A Coruna, University of Zagreb and Technical University Hamburg.
             </p>
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-33 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-894ea97" data-element_type="column" data-id="894ea97">
       <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
        <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-21b4ea4 elementor-view-default elementor-position-top elementor-mobile-position-top elementor-widget elementor-widget-icon-box" data-element_type="widget" data-id="21b4ea4" data-widget_type="icon-box.default">
         <div class="elementor-widget-container">
          <div class="elementor-icon-box-wrapper">
           <div class="elementor-icon-box-icon">
            <span class="elementor-icon elementor-animation-">
             <i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-compress-arrows-alt">
             </i>
            </span>
           </div>
           <div class="elementor-icon-box-content">
            <h3 class="elementor-icon-box-title">
             <span>
              OBJECTIVES
             </span>
            </h3>
            <p class="elementor-icon-box-description">
             <p style="text-align: justify;">
              SEAS 4.0 Master programme will train future engineers and increase their employment competitiveness in the multidisciplinary and global domain of ship design, construction, and management.
             </p>
             <p style="text-align: justify;">
              SEAS 4.0 Master programme will couple environmental and legal competencies, knowledge of the economic framework of green and sustainable economy, digitalisation related to the newest needs in the fields of shipbuilding and maritime transport in student-centered education increasing cultural competencies and life-long learning attitudes.
             </p>
             <p <="" p="" style="text-align: justify;">
             </p>
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-33 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-7e91566" data-element_type="column" data-id="7e91566">
       <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
        <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-e3c4270 elementor-view-default elementor-position-top elementor-mobile-position-top elementor-widget elementor-widget-icon-box" data-element_type="widget" data-id="e3c4270" data-widget_type="icon-box.default">
         <div class="elementor-widget-container">
          <div class="elementor-icon-box-wrapper">
           <div class="elementor-icon-box-icon">
            <span class="elementor-icon elementor-animation-">
             <i aria-hidden="true" class="far fa-list-alt">
             </i>
            </span>
           </div>
           <div class="elementor-icon-box-content">
            <h3 class="elementor-icon-box-title">
             <span>
              PROGRAMME DESCRIPTION
             </span>
            </h3>
            <p class="elementor-icon-box-description">
             <p style="text-align: justify;">
              SEAS 4.0 Master programme is based on a series of content blocks which represent the basic topics which are dealt with during the degree:
             </p>
             <ul>
              <li style="text-align: justify;">
               Energy Efficiency and Sustainability (EES)
              </li>
              <li style="text-align: justify;">
               Simulation and modelling (SIM)
              </li>
              <li style="text-align: justify;">
               Information systems and data management (IDM)
              </li>
              <li style="text-align: justify;">
               Robotics & Autonomous Systems (RAS)
              </li>
              <li style="text-align: justify;">
               Polar routes challenges in structure and technology (PR)
              </li>
              <li style="text-align: justify;">
               Ship operation, management and infologistics (SO)
              </li>
             </ul>
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
    </section>

   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

   <div class="page-header">
    <div class="container">
     <h1 class="entry-title">
      SEAS 4.0
     </h1>
    </div>
   </div>
   <div class="site-content" id="content">
    <div class="container left-sidebar" id="content-inside">
     <div class="content-area" id="primary">
      <main class="site-main" id="main" role="main">
       <article class="post-2644 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-2644">
        <header class="entry-header">
        </header>
        <div class="entry-content">
         <p>
          <a href="http://www.master-seas40.unina.it/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/1.jpg">
           <img alt="" class="size-medium wp-image-2509 alignleft" decoding="async" height="300" src="http://www.master-seas40.unina.it/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/1-225x300.jpg" width="225"/>
          </a>
          Sustainable Ship and Shipping 4.0 (SEAS 4.0) is a year-and-half-long (90 ECTS) integrated, international, innovative, and methodologically diversified course to award a double Master Degree. It is taught in English and jointly designed by SEAS 4.0 Consortium Universities: University of Napoli Federico II, University of A Coruna and University of Zagreb.
         </p>
         <p>
          The development of the SEAS 4.0 Master Programme has been inspired by an emerging necessity to enlarge and improve the knowledge of Naval Architecture and Marine Engineering curricula with elements of Ship Management, Infologistics and Sustainability concepts in the frame of Industry 4.0. Such elements will be required skills for future Ship Designers, Marine Engineers and Ship Managers.
         </p>
         <p>
          SEAS 4.0 is tailored for students who hold a minimum of 240 ECTS in Naval Architecture and Marine Engineering or other relevant technical degrees (mechanical, civil, aerospace, etc). SEAS 4.0 offers them a possibility to extend their knowledge and skills within a multidisciplinary team.
         </p>
         <p>
          SEAS 4.0 is based on a holistic approach to higher education of new experts ready to work in an increasingly digitalized, automated, and globally mobile environment.
         </p>
        </div>
       </article>
      </main>
     </div>

   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

   <div class="page-header">
    <div class="container">
     <h1 class="entry-title">
      Objectives
     </h1>
    </div>
   </div>
   <div class="site-content" id="content">
    <div class="container left-sidebar" id="content-inside">
     <div class="content-area" id="primary">
      <main class="site-main" id="main" role="main">
       <article class="post-2932 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-2932">
        <header class="entry-header">
        </header>
        <div class="entry-content">
         <p>
          In marine and maritime fields, there is an increasing need for engineers able of using advanced computational tools, facing ever-changing regulatory landscapes, managing highly automated production, and understanding the effect of autonomy on ship safety and security.
         </p>
         <p>
          Furthermore, the engineers are increasingly being challenged by requirements for efficient design of innovative and unconventional vessels, new shipping routes and more stringent environmental regulations.
         </p>
         <p>
          The objectives of EMJMD SEAS 4.0 programme are to train future engineers and increase their employment competitiveness in the multidisciplinary and global domain of ship design, construction, and management.
         </p>
         <p>
          EMJMD SEAS4.0 programme couples environmental and legal competencies, knowledge of the economic framework of green and sustainable economy, digitalisation related to the newest needs in the fields of shipbuilding and maritime transport in student-centered education, increasing cultural competencies and life-long learning attitudes.
         </p>
        </div>
       </article>
      </main>
     </div>

					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );

					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {

				} );

   <div class="page-header">
    <div class="container">
     <h1 class="entry-title">
      Degrees
     </h1>
    </div>
   </div>
   <div class="site-content" id="content">
    <div class="container left-sidebar" id="content-inside">
     <div class="content-area" id="primary">
      <main class="site-main" id="main" role="main">
       <article class="post-1212 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-1212">
        <header class="entry-header">
        </header>
        <div class="entry-content">
         <p>
          Students who fulfil all requirements of the SEAS 4.0 Master Programme will be granted a
          <strong>
           double degree,
          </strong>
          issued independently by the
          <strong>
           University of Naples Federico II
          </strong>
          and the
          <strong>
           University of A Coruña
          </strong>
          with an explicit reference to the third semester mobility:
         </p>
         <p>
          –
          <strong>
           Sustainable Ship and Shipping 4.0 Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree (SEAS 4.0) /
          </strong>
          <strong>
           <em>
            Master interateneo di II livello Sustainable Ship and Shipping 4.0
           </em>
          </strong>
          , issued by the University of Naples Federico II.
         </p>
         <p>
          –
          <strong>
           Sustainable Ship and Shipping 4.0 Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree (SEAS 4.0) / Master Universitario Erasmus Mundus en Sostenibilidad e Industria 4.0 aplicada al Sector Marítimo (SEAS 4.0)
          </strong>
          , issued by the University of A Coruña.
         </p>
         <p>
          Additionally, a
          <strong>
           Joint Diploma Supplement
          </strong>
          written in English and delivered by the Coordinating University (UNINA) will describe:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           the overall organization of the Master programme
          </li>
          <li>
           the details of the student’s study programme and mobility and
          </li>
          <li>
           full transcript of all ECTS points obtained during the master programme
          </li>
         </ul>
        </div>
       </article>
      </main>
     </div>
     <div class="widget-area sidebar" id="secondary" role="complementary">
      <aside class="widget widget_search" id="search-1">
       <form action="https://www.master-seas40.unina.it:443/" class="search-form" method="get" role="search">
        <label>
         <span class="screen-reader-text">
          Ricerca per:
         </span>
         <input class="search-field" name="s" placeholder="Cerca …" type="search" value=""/>
        </label>
        <input class="search-submit" type="submit" value="Cerca"/>

   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

   <div class="page-header">
    <div class="container">
     <h1 class="entry-title">
      FAQ
     </h1>
    </div>
   </div>
   <div class="site-content" id="content">
    <div class="container left-sidebar" id="content-inside">
     <div class="content-area" id="primary">
      <main class="site-main" id="main" role="main">
       <article class="post-1216 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-1216">
        <header class="entry-header">
        </header>
        <div class="entry-content">
         <p>
          You can contact us at infomasterseas40@unina.it or you can find other FAQ on the EACEA link.
          <br/>
          <a href="https://eacea.ec.europa.eu/erasmus-plus/erasmus-mundus-joint-master-degrees/faq_en">
           https://eacea.ec.europa.eu/erasmus-plus/erasmus-mundus-joint-master-degrees/faq_en
          </a>
         </p>
         <p>
          Some of the FAQ are questions collected during our Meet us on Teams sessions and are concerning EMJMD SEAS 4.0 only.
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           Which degrees are accepted?
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p>
          Naval Architecture and Marine Engineering
         </p>
         <p>
          Maritime Engineering
         </p>
         <p>
          Nautical and Maritime Transport
         </p>
         <p>
          Mechanical Engineering
         </p>
         <p>
          Civil Engineering
         </p>
         <p>
          Aerospace Engineering
         </p>
         <p>
          Electrical Engineering
         </p>
         <p>
          Electric Power Engineering
         </p>
         <p>
          Electronic Engineering
         </p>
         <p>
          Applied Mathematics
         </p>
         <p>
          Physics
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           Is there an age limit?
          </strong>
          No, there is not. Normally our students are in the range of 23-33 years old.
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           Can the reference letter be written from a head officer or people from the working company other than from Professors?
          </strong>
          Yes, it can.
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           Can the reference letter be sent directly to the coordinator?
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p>
          Yes, the reference letter can be sent directly to the coordinator of the Program before the applications deadline:
         </p>
         <p>
          Prof. Ermina BEGOVIC
         </p>
         <p>
          Dipartmento di Ingegneria Industriale
         </p>
         <p>
          Via Claudio 21, 80125 Napoli (Italy)
         </p>
         <p>
          Email: begovic@unina.it
         </p>
         <p>
          Phone: +39 081 7683708
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           Is there a special procedure for the application that includes the scholarship?
          </strong>
          The online application directly includes the scholarship request, and at the end of the procedure the applicant can select or not a possible self-funding enrolment in case he does not win the scholarship but passes the selection procedures.
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           What level of English language and what kind of certificate is needed for the application?
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p>
          The requested English level is at least B2. The valid certificates are: IELTS, TOFEL, a document from the university, or a certificate of previous studies in English language.
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           Can your passport be considered as a proof of residence?
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p>
          Yes, if you are living in your country. Applicants who do not live in their home country and have a different residence from their passport need to upload a proof of residence. All others can upload a Passport, ID card or driving licence to certify their residence place. The proof of residence will indicate the distance from the coordinating institution. Business travelling during the application procedure, is not considered, if there was no official change of address.
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           How many pages should the motivation letter be?
          </strong>
          No particular importance is given to the length of the motivation letter. Generally, 1 or 2 pages are sufficient.
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           When and how should the personal video be uploaded?
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p>
          The personal video should be uploaded during the application phase, not before the interview. It can be shared on google drive or with a YouTube link. Avoid we transfer which has an expire date.
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           What are the most frequently asked questions during the interview?
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p>
          The most frequently asked questions are the motivation to join the master and general questions on ships knowledge: basic structure; building materials; forces acting on ships; hull form coefficients such as CB, or definition of Froude Number, Hook law, Young Modulus, etc.
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           Can the applicants have a master’s degree scheduled for June or July after the application deadline?
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p>
          Yes, students which will accomplish a master’s degree before the beginning of master SEAS program can apply.
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           What is the minimum number of ECTS for the application?
          </strong>
          Applicants must have at least 4 years of bachelor studies.
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           Can the mandatory courses be changed for the elective ones?
          </strong>
          No, all mandatory courses are MANDATORY.
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           What could be the topic of the thesis?
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p>
          The topic of the thesis can be chosen by the student, the professor or by the internship company. Find some examples at
          <a href="https://www.master-seas40.unina.it/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/SEAS-40_Thesis_Topics_21_22_Statistics.pdf">
           https://www.master-seas40.unina.it/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/SEAS-40_Thesis_Topics_21_22_Statistics.pdf
          </a>
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           How can you face accommodation problems and are there residences for students in the four host institutions of the programme?
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p>
          In Naples, the International Welcome Desk (IWD) organization will support and help students with their accommodation and first steps settling in. There are also student residences in Ferrol, Zagreb and Hamburg.
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           What are the selection criteria during the interview phase?
          </strong>
          Applicants will be selected based on their academic competencies, personal motivation and English level.
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           I already had an Erasmus Mundus/Erasmus+ scholarship in the past. Can I apply again for an Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree (EMJMD) scholarship?
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p>
          <em>
           If you received an Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree (EMJMD), Master Course (EMMC) or Joint Doctorate (EMJD) scholarship in the past, you
           <strong>
            cannot
           </strong>
           apply for an EMJMD scholarship.
          </em>
         </p>
         <p>
          <em>
           If you previously received an Erasmus Mundus Action 2 Partnerships scholarship, you
           <strong>
            can
           </strong>
           apply for an EMJMD scholarship.
          </em>
         </p>
         <p>
          <em>
           If you previously received other types of grants, for example Erasmus+ Study grant or Traineeship grant, you
           <strong>
            can
           </strong>
           apply for an EMJMD scholarship.
          </em>
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           What is the 12 months residence rule?
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p>
          <em>
           Students from partner countries who have carried out their main activity (studies, work, etc.) for more than a total of 12 months over the last five years in any of the program countries will be considered program country applicants according to the 12-months rule.
          </em>
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           I have two nationalities. Under which should I apply for an Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree
          </strong>
          <strong>
           (EMJMD)?
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p>
          <em>
           You have to choose under which nationality you want to apply.
          </em>
         </p>
         <p>
          <em>
           Good to know:
          </em>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           <em>
            EMJMDs may offer a higher number of scholarships for Partner country students
           </em>
          </li>
          <li>
           <em>
            The scholarship amounts for Programme and Partner country students may differ
           </em>
          </li>
          <li>
           <em>
            Check if the
           </em>
           <a href="https://ec.europa.eu/info/funding-tenders/opportunities/portal/screen/support/faq;categories=;programme=null;actions=;keyword=EMJMD/10112">
            <em>
             12-month residence rule
            </em>
           </a>
           <em>
            applies to you
           </em>
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <strong>
           Can I interrupt or postpone my Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree (EMJMD) studies?
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p>
          <em>
           If you need to temporarily interrupt your studies, you should immediately contact the Coordinator of your EMJMD. Any interruption has to be approved by the Coordinator. They will be able to give you more information regarding the procedure.
          </em>
         </p>
         <p>
          <em>
           If you have to temporarily leave the EMJMD course for justified reasons, your scholarship may be put on hold for a certain period of time until you are again physically present and can actively continue pursuing the course activities.
          </em>
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           Can I get EU funding for an internship / training / conference if I am not an Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree (EMJMD) student?
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p>
          <em>
           EMJMDs only provide scholarships to students enrolled in EMJMD courses.
          </em>
         </p>
         <p>
          <em>
           If you are an EMJMD student, remember that any internship / training / conference during the EMJMD period should be agreed upon with the Coordinator of the course.
          </em>
         </p>
         <p>
          <em>
           If you are not an EMJMD student, please contact the International Relations Office of your university.
          </em>
         </p>
         <p>
          <em>
           For your information, the Erasmus+ Traineeship grants provide financial support for internships to students enrolled in higher education institutions in Programme countries. However, these grants are not managed by EACEA. Get in contact with the International Relations Office of your university for more information.
          </em>
         </p>
         <p>
          <em>
          </em>
          <strong>
           Can I work during my studies in an Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree (EMJMD)?
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p>
          <em>
           Erasmus+ scholarships are designed as full-time scholarships. As such, they should provide enough resources for students to be able to concentrate on their studies without the necessity of paid employment. The courses require intensive academic activity. Moreover, work permit conditions for non-EU students vary from country to country.
          </em>
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           Can I do
          </strong>
          <strong>
           an internship or study at an Associate partner of the Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree (EMJMD)?
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p>
          <em>
           The EMJMD is responsible for determining the students’ mobility schedule. Any study period spent at an Associate partner must be agreed upon with the Coordinator of the EMJMD
          </em>
         </p>
         <p>
          <em>
           As common practice, the Associate partners offer internship or research possibilities to the students as part of the study programme
          </em>
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           Do I need insurance when I attend an Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree? Should I pay for it?
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p>
          <em>
           A mandatory insurance coverage is provided by the Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree (EMJMD) at least to the students who receive an EMJMD scholarship.
          </em>
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           Which insurance services are included in the health and accident insurance coverage provided under Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree?
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p>
          <em>
           The minimum requirements are stated by the Erasmus + guidelines available here
          </em>
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://eacea.ec.europa.eu/sites/eacea-site/files/documents/2c_guidelines-for-insurance.pdf">
           https://eacea.ec.europa.eu/sites/eacea-site/files/documents/2c_guidelines-for-insurance.pdf
          </a>
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           When attending an Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree (EMJMD) can I choose the countries where I want to study?
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p>
          <em>
           The countries where you can study are defined by the EMJMD. To know more, contact the Coordinator.
          </em>
         </p>
         <p>
          <em>
           As a general rule, you must study in a minimum of two different Programme countries.
          </em>
         </p>
         <p>
          <em>
           You may study / research / do an internship in an institution or in a country outside the EMJMD consortium, always upon agreement with the Coordinator of the EMJMD.
          </em>
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           How can I obtain my visa to study in an Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree (EMJMD)?
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p>
          <em>
           The Coordinator of the course you will study will provide you with guidance and support when applying for a visa. However, you are entirely responsible for completing your visa request and for obtaining it before the start of your studies. As the procedure can be time-consuming and differs from one country to another, it is best to start applying the soonest possible.
          </em>
         </p>
         <p>
          <em>
          </em>
          <strong>
           Will I receive an Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree (EMJMD) scholarship if I am on the reserve list?
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p>
          <em>
           The number of EMJMD scholarships is limited and the selection is very competitive. Good candidates, who are however not selected for an EMJMD scholarship, are placed on a reserve list in a ranked order. Depending on your rank on the reserve list, you might be offered an EMJMD scholarship if one or several students on the main list reject the scholarship offer.
          </em>
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           Can I study part-time in an Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree (EMJMD)?
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p>
          <em>
           No.
          </em>
          <em>
           EMJMDs are full-time higher education courses, and as such they require the full-time participation of students.
          </em>
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           Where can I find alternative sources of funding for my studies?
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p>
          <em>
           If you wish to study abroad or to do a traineeship abroad, the best is to contact the International Relations Office of your university and enquire about student mobility.
          </em>
         </p>
         <p>
          <em>
           You can also have a look at:
          </em>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           <em>
            the Intra-Africa programme
           </em>
          </li>
          <li>
           <em>
            the Master loan
           </em>
          </li>
          <li>
           <em>
            the Erasmus+ programme website
           </em>
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <strong>
           Can I apply for an Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree (EMJMD) before I graduate?
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p>
          <em>
           If you are applying for an EMJMD and have not yet obtained the required undergraduate degree, contact the EMJMD Coordinator.
          </em>
         </p>
         <p>
          <em>
           If you expect to graduate before the start of the EMJMD, the Coordinator may evaluate your application and make a conditional offer.
          </em>
         </p>
         <p>
          <em>
           Nevertheless, bear in mind that every EMJMD is solely responsible for determining its application and selection procedure.
          </em>
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           What does the Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree (EMJMD) scholarship cover?
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p>
          <em>
           The EMJMD scholarship covers:
           <br/>
          </em>
          <em>
           the participation costs, including tuition fees and mandatory insurance coverage. Most of the time, the EMJMD directly deducts the participation costs from the scholarship.
          </em>
         </p>
         <p>
          <em>
           a contribution to travel costs:
          </em>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           <em>
            1000 €/year for a scholarship holder residing in a Programme country, or
           </em>
          </li>
          <li>
           <em>
            2000 €/year for a scholarship holder residing in a Partner country less than 4000 km from the EMJMD coordinating institution, or
           </em>
          </li>
          <li>
           <em>
            3000 €/year for a scholarship holder residing in a Partner country 4000 km or more from the EMJMD coordinating institution.
           </em>
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <em>
          </em>
          <em>
           a contribution to settling-in costs: 1000 €, for scholarship holders residing in a Partner country only.
          </em>
         </p>
         <p>
          <em>
           a monthly living allowance of 1000 €/month for all scholarship holders.
          </em>
         </p>
         <p>
          <em>
           However:
          </em>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           <em>
            scholarship holders studying in their country of residence will not receive the subsistence allowance during that period;
           </em>
          </li>
          <li>
           <em>
            a scholarship holder from a Partner country cannot receive the subsistence allowance for more than 3 months when studying in any Partner country.
           </em>
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <strong>
           How should I apply for an Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree (EMJMD) if I am from a Partner country but I am living in Europe?
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p>
          <em>
           Check if the 12-month residence rule applies to you:
          </em>
         </p>
         <p>
          <em>
           If you are a national from a Partner country and have carried out your main activity (studies, training or work) for more than a total of 12 months over the last 5 years in one or several Programme country(ies), you should apply as Programme country candidate. The wording “total of 12 months” refers to all possible cases:
          </em>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           <em>
            a single period in one Programme country
           </em>
          </li>
          <li>
           <em>
            several periods in one Programme country
           </em>
          </li>
          <li>
           <em>
            the sum of different periods in different Programme countries
           </em>
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <em>
           The 5-year reference period is calculated backwards from the EMJMD scholarship application deadline. This 12-month rule does not apply to Partner country candidates who hold refugee status in a Programme country.
          </em>
         </p>
         <p>
          <em>
          </em>
          <em>
           If you are a national from a Partner country and the 12-month residence rule does not apply to you, you should apply as a Partner country candidate.
          </em>
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           Which countries are “partner country” and which ones are “program country”?
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p>
          <em>
           The list of countries whose nationals are eligible for a scholarship is presented
           <a href="https://ec.europa.eu/programmes/erasmus-plus/about/who-can-take-part_en">
            here
           </a>
           . A differentiation between program country students and partner country students is applied.
           <br/>
          </em>
          <em>
           No more than 25% of the total number of scholarships available will be awarded to program country students.
          </em>
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           Can I stay in my home country during the EMJMD Course?
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p>
          <em>
           Scholarship holders spending part of the EMJMD course in their country of residence are not entitled to benefit from the monthly subsistence allowance for this period. Partner country students spending part of the EMJMD course in any partner country are not entitled to the monthly subsistence allowance for this period.
          </em>
         </p>
         <div id="gtx-trans" style="position: absolute; left: -58px; top: 48px;">
          <div class="gtx-trans-icon">
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </article>

   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

   <div class="page-header">
    <div class="container">
     <h1 class="entry-title">
      Consortium
     </h1>
    </div>
   </div>
   <div class="site-content" id="content">
    <div class="container left-sidebar" id="content-inside">
     <div class="content-area" id="primary">
      <main class="site-main" id="main" role="main">
       <article class="post-1581 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-1581">
        <header class="entry-header">
        </header>
        <div class="entry-content">
         <p>
          The Master in Sustainable Ship and Shipping 4.0 (SEAS 4.0) is an Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree (EMJMD) offered by four universities:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           University of the Naples Federico II
          </li>
          <li>
           University of A Coruña
          </li>
          <li>
           University of Zagreb
          </li>
          <li>
           Technical University Hamburg
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          These partner universities jointly engage in the overall execution and development of the master.
         </p>
         <p>
          Partners agreed upon sharing the responsibility for each phase of the project, from assessing the needs, designing the course and implementation to Quality Assurance assessment and dissemination.
         </p>
         <p>
          Bringing together associated partner universities, enterprises and non-academic bodies, EMJMD SEAS 4.0 Consortium aims at consolidating and developing new synergies and cooperative efforts for sustainable ship and shipping, under the threat of Industry 4.0 and Sustainable Development Goals.
         </p>
         <p>
          The master is co-funded by the Erasmus+ Programme of the European Union.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="http://www.master-seas40.unina.it/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/img_Erasmus-cofunded.jpg">
           <img alt="" class="alignnone wp-image-1975" decoding="async" height="92" src="http://www.master-seas40.unina.it/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/img_Erasmus-cofunded.jpg" width="319"/>
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
       </article>
      </main>
     </div>

					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

                <div class="elementor-menu-anchor" id="unina">
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-4b92391 elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="4b92391" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
               <div class="elementor-widget-container">
                <strong>
                 <a href="/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/FOTO45.JPG.jpg">
                  <img alt="" class="wp-image-1375 alignleft" decoding="async" height="148" src="/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/FOTO45.JPG-300x288.jpg" width="154"/>
                 </a>
                 <a href="https://www.unina.it">
                  The University of Naples Federico II
                 </a>
                </strong>
                was founded in 1224. It was the first publicly funded university in Europe. Nowadays the university offers courses in essentially all academic disciplines, leading to 155 graduate level degrees.
                <a href="http://www.unina.it/-/768614-dipartimento-di-ingegneria-industriale">
                 Department of Industrial Engineering DII
                </a>
                was formed of five pre-existing departments: Aerospace Engineering, Energetics, Thermal Fluid Dynamics & Applied Environmental Control Systems, Mechanical Engineering, Naval Architecture, and Economics and Management Engineering. Department takes part in several double degrees and Joint Doctorates as well as in EU research projects.

During the first semester of the SEAS 4.0, courses are given by Naval Architecture and Mechanical Engineering Units. Key staff of the SEAS 4.0 at UNINA are Professors: Ermina Begovic (coordinator of the SEAS 4.0), coordinator of the
                <a href="https://www.unina.it/en_GB/ricerca/ricerca-dipartimentale/dii/marine-hydrodynamics-mahy">
                 Marine Hydrodynamics Group at DII
                </a>
                ; Antonio Lanzotti, coordinator of Joint
                <a href="http://www.ideas.unina.it/">
                 Laboratory “Interactive DEsign And Simulation” (IDEAS)
                </a>
                and Carlo Bertorello (Ship Design, Coordinator of Students Sailing Team DII). During the stay at UNINA two important laboratories will be actively used in teaching: Towing tank (135x9x4.5m) and IDEAS, which is organized in 4 labs: COGITO – computer geometric modelling and simulation; IDEAinVR – interactive design and ergonomics applications in virtual reality; CREAMI – center of reverse engineering and additive manufacturing innovation; SQUARE – statistics, quality and reliability for innovation.

At UNINA, besides
                <a href="http://www.ideas.unina.it/">
                 IDEAS Lab
                </a>
                and towing tank, the Affiliated Partners offered the internship with the possibility of developing thesis in collaboration also with the Associated Partner Universities.
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </section>
          <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-314cf0b elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="314cf0b">
           <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">
            <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-100 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-6fb7737" data-element_type="column" data-id="6fb7737">

              <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-4e9bc02 elementor-widget-divider--view-line elementor-widget elementor-widget-divider" data-element_type="widget" data-id="4e9bc02" data-widget_type="divider.default">

          <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-425da7c elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="425da7c">
           <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">
            <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-100 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-8858948" data-element_type="column" data-id="8858948">
             <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
              <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-be4efee elementor-widget elementor-widget-menu-anchor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="be4efee" data-widget_type="menu-anchor.default">
               <div class="elementor-widget-container">
                <div class="elementor-menu-anchor" id="udc">
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-dcb7f7d elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="dcb7f7d" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
               <div class="elementor-widget-container">
                <strong>
                 <a href="/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/udc_photo.jpg">
                  <img alt="" class="wp-image-1789 alignleft" decoding="async" height="136" src="/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/udc_photo-300x199.jpg" width="205"/>
                 </a>
                 <a href="https://www.udc.es/">
                  The University of A Coruña (UDC)
                 </a>
                </strong>
                was founded in 1989. It is composed of 24 Faculties/Schools, has 39 ongoing BSc degrees and 56 MSc degrees, from which 6 are international ones. It has more than 1300 teaching staff and more than 15.000 students, divided in two main locations: A Coruña (main campus) and Ferrol.
During the second semester of the SEAS 4.0, UDC courses will be lectured by staff from the Departments of Naval Architecture and Marine Engineering, Economics, Computer Science and Information Technology and Computer Technology, and being involved in Naval Architecture and Marine Engineering bachelor and master degrees, in the Mechanical Engineering bachelor and Industrial Engineering master degree and Master in Computer Science and in Cybersecurity. The common point of these staff, is that they are involved in the
                <a href="https://umi.udc.es/">
                 Unidad Mixta de Investigación Navantia – UDC
                </a>
                , which is a research consortium between Navantia S.A., the Government of Galicia and the UDC, to transfer and implement the 4.0 industry paradigms from the academia to the shipbuilding industry, lasting from 2015 to 2021. Although they have expertise in different topics, all of them are under the framework of the 4.0 paradigms, especially in the field of shipbuilding.

During the second semester, one main research facility will be used by the students: the UDC towing tank (60 x 4.2 x 1.80 m), which is situated in the Technological Research Centre (CIT) of the UDC in Ferrol, next to the Higher Polytechnic School, where SEAS 4.0 degree will be implemented. Key staff in UDC related to SEAS 4.0 project, include Marcos Míguez González (coordinator of the bachelor degree in Marine Engineering and Naval Architecture in the UDC), Vicente Díaz Casás (coordinator of the master degree in Marine Engineering and Naval Architecture in the UDC and Deputy Dean in International Relations of the Higher Polytechnic School of the UDC) and Anne Gosset (Coordinator of the Technological Research Centre).

At UDC the strong collaboration and connection of the many UDC research groups with the Shipyard Navantia in the framework of 4.0 industry will give the possibility to students to apply the academic knowledge of Industry 4.0 directly in the ship building practice.

                 <div class="gtx-trans-icon">

              <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-f8b6b6e elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="f8b6b6e" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
               <div class="elementor-widget-container">
                <strong>
                 <a href="/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/University-of-Zagreb-UNIZG-campus-610x316-1.jpg">
                  <img alt="" class="wp-image-1393 alignleft" decoding="async" height="128" loading="lazy" src="/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/University-of-Zagreb-UNIZG-campus-610x316-1-300x155.jpg" width="248"/>
                 </a>
                 <a href="http://www.unizg.hr/homepage/">
                  The University of Zagreb
                 </a>
                </strong>
                is the oldest Croatian university and the oldest university in South East Europe founded in 1669 with more than 30 faculties in all academic disciplines. Faculty of Mechanical. Engineering and Naval Architecture (UNIZG FSB) is the principal Croatian institution for university level education and research in mechanical engineering, naval architecture and aeronautical engineering. Since the first lectures held at the Royal Technical College in 1919 the Faculty has been providing state-of-the-art education, successfully combining general and expert knowledge.

Personnel of
                <a href="https://www.fsb.unizg.hr/index.php?fsbonline_en&department_of_naval_architecture_and_offshore_engineering">
                 Department of Naval Architecture and Offshore Engineering
                </a>
                (DNAOE) that will be directly involved in SEAS 4.0 have lots of experience in implementation and execution of different research (EP6, FP7, Horizon 2020) and educational (TEMPUS) EU and national projects. DNAOE has a world recognized expertise in the field of ship structural design and optimization and strong connection with different industry stakeholders (shipyards, design offices, classification societies, shipping company, software development company, etc.).

Large experience in development and use of different simulation software for ship structural analysis and design of teaching staff involved in the SEAS 4.0 will be directly included in related courses. Key staff in charge of the SEAS 4.0 at UNIZG are Prof. Jerolim Andric (Head of Department of Naval Architecture and Offshore Engineering) and Prof. Smiljko Rudan (Head of the Chair of Ship Structures).

                <div class="elementor-menu-anchor" id="unituhh">

              <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-656d947 elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="656d947" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
               <div class="elementor-widget-container">
                <a href="/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/TUHH_Education.jpg">
                 <img alt="" class="wp-image-1252 alignleft" decoding="async" height="83" loading="lazy" src="/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/TUHH_Education.jpg" width="146"/>
                </a>
                The
                <a href="https://www.tuhh.de/tuhh/startseite.html">
                 TUHH
                </a>
                is one of Germany’s youngest and most successful universities. Plans for a university of technology in the Süderelbe area of Hamburg go back to the 1920s. Fifty years later, in 1978, the Hamburg University of Technology came into being, its mission to promote structural change in the region.

Research activities began in 1980 and teaching in 1982/83. Now, the TUHH has around 100 professors and 1,150 employees (including 500 academic staff, inclusive of those with salaries from third-party funding). With around 8,400 students, this makes for an excellent staff-student ratio.

The priority of research, an interdisciplinary approach, innovation, regionalism and internationalism are the obligatory foundations for what we do.

Research, teaching and technology transfer are centered around the guiding theme of developing technology for people. Key staff in charge of SEAS 4.0 at TUHH are Professors Moustafa-Abdel Maksoud (head of the institute for fluid dynamics and ship theory), Thomas Rung (fluid dynamics), Alexander Düster (numerical methods) and Sören Ehlers (head of the institute for ship structural design and analysis and expert in Arctic technology).

   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

                <a href="https://www.cineca.it/">
                 <img alt="" class="attachment-large size-large wp-image-3244" decoding="async" height="169" src="https://www.master-seas40.unina.it/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/cineca-social.jpg" width="300"/>

            <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-50 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-821be02" data-element_type="column" data-id="821be02">
             <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
              <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-2475e4f elementor-widget elementor-widget-menu-anchor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="2475e4f" data-widget_type="menu-anchor.default">
               <div class="elementor-widget-container">
                <div class="elementor-menu-anchor" id="cineca">
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-ea7eda9 elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="ea7eda9" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
               <div class="elementor-widget-container">
                <p style="text-align: justify;">
                 <strong>
                  <a href="http://www.hpc.CINECA.it">
                   CINECA
                  </a>
                 </strong>
                 (ITALY) – Consorzio Interuniversitario established in 1969, is a non-profit consortium of 69 Italian Universities, 11 Italian National Institutions, and the Ministry of Education, University and Research (MIUR). CINECA is the largest Italian supercomputing centre with an HPC/HPDA environment equipped with cutting-edge technology and highly-qualified personnel which cooperates with researchers in the use of the infrastructure, in both the academic and industrial fields. CINECA’s mission is to enable the Italian and European research community to accelerate scientific discovery using HPC/HPDA resources in a profitable way, exploiting the newest technological advances in computing, data management, storage systems, tools, services and expertise at large.
                </p>
                <p style="text-align: justify;">
                 The SCAI Department in CINECA has a long experience in cooperating with the researchers in parallelising, enabling and scaling-up their applications in different computational disciplines, covering engineering, CFD, mathematics, condensed matter physics, astrophysics, geophysics, chemistry, earth sciences, life sciences and bioinformatics, but also “non-traditional” ones, such as biomedicine, archaeology and data-analytics.
                </p>
                <p style="text-align: justify;">
                 CINECA has a wide experience in providing education and training in the different fields of parallel computing and computational sciences and is one of the six PRACE Advanced Training Centres (PATCs).
                </p>
                <p style="text-align: justify;">
                 The CFD team has a strong background in marine engineering and along the years, with the support of the H2020 EU projects Fortissimo2, LINCOLN and eSHyIPS has developed an innovative virtual towing tank framework, LincoSim.
                </p>
                <p style="text-align: justify;">
                 Key staff in charge of SEAS 4.0 are: Claudio Arlandini (Project Manager), Francesco Salvadore and Raffaele Ponzini (Senior CFD experts).
                </p>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>

            <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-50 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-5aae66e" data-element_type="column" data-id="5aae66e">
             <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
              <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-5ee3e1e elementor-widget elementor-widget-menu-anchor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="5ee3e1e" data-widget_type="menu-anchor.default">
               <div class="elementor-widget-container">
                <div class="elementor-menu-anchor" id="dtu">

              <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-696082d elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="696082d" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
               <div class="elementor-widget-container">
                <p style="text-align: justify;">
                 <a href="https://www.dtu.dk/english">
                  <strong>
                   DTU (DENMARK)
                  </strong>
                 </a>
                 is associated partner of the SEAS 4.0 programme. The Technical University of Denmark is an independent university focusing on education, research, research-based advisory and innovation. The university’s main activities are anchored in 17 departments, 7 centres and a national laboratory for sustainable energy. The university has more than 11000 students enrolled in the several multifaceted BSc and MSc training programs, and each year welcomes more than 1000 international students. DTU is a founding member of the Nordic Five Tech Alliance and the Euro Tech Universities Alliance. DTU participates in SEAS 4.0 with the Department of Mechanical Engineering and the Department of Electrical Engineering where expertise on naval architecture, ship hydrodynamics, ship propulsion, ship operations, and marine automation is rooted.
                </p>
                <p class="Normale1" style="text-align: justify;">
                 Key scientists Ulrik D. Nielsen (associate professor and adjunct associate professor at NTNU-AMOS) and Roberto Galeazzi (associate professor and head of Centre for Collaborative Autonomous Systems) will actively participate in the SEAS 4.0 programme by delivering courses at UDC and hosting MSc students for thesis work.
                </p>

                 <img alt="" class="attachment-large size-large wp-image-3251" decoding="async" height="102" loading="lazy" src="https://www.master-seas40.unina.it/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/Touro-College-Berlin.jpg" width="300"/>
                </a>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-50 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-5bc29f5" data-element_type="column" data-id="5bc29f5">
             <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
              <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-6171bcc elementor-widget elementor-widget-menu-anchor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="6171bcc" data-widget_type="menu-anchor.default">
               <div class="elementor-widget-container">
                <div class="elementor-menu-anchor" id="tuhh">
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-446cbed elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="446cbed" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
               <div class="elementor-widget-container">
                <p style="text-align: justify;">
                 <strong>
                  <a href="https://www.touroberlin.de/">
                   Touro College Berlin (TCB)
                  </a>
                 </strong>
                 in Germany is a private Jewish-American university with the main mission to spread multicultural awareness and appreciation of diversity in its core curriculum as well as its principles of governance.
                 <br/>
                 As an Associate Partner, TCB brings expertise on teaching and learning in multicultural environments, assessment of learning outcomes, and psychological well being of students as part of academic success.
                </p>
                <p style="text-align: justify;">
                 TCB is a teaching-focused HEI, but key staff are involved in international research projects on various topics relevant to emerging adults. TCB offers undergraduate programs in Management and Psychology, a Master’s program in Holocaust Communication and Tolerance, and an MBA program. TCB is an immensely diverse institution with students and staff representing more than 30 different countries.
                </p>
                <p style="text-align: justify;">
                 Key staff for SEAS 4.0 is Prof. Larisa Buhin-Krenek, Dean of Undergraduate Programs and a counseling psychologist specializing in Multicultural Counseling and Consultation. Prof. Buhin-Krenek researches identity development, resilience, student coping, and culturally inclusive higher education from a cross-cultural perspective.
                </p>
                <div id="gtx-trans" style="position: absolute; left: 235px; top: 270px;">
                 <div class="gtx-trans-icon">
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>

                 <img alt="" class="attachment-large size-large wp-image-3248" decoding="async" height="157" loading="lazy" src="https://www.master-seas40.unina.it/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/logo_Antwerp.jpg" width="300"/>

              <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-405f1fb elementor-widget elementor-widget-menu-anchor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="405f1fb" data-widget_type="menu-anchor.default">

              <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-4b9c8d8 elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="4b9c8d8" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
               <div class="elementor-widget-container">
                <p style="text-align: justify;">
                 <strong>
                  <a href="https://www.uantwerpen.be/en/">
                   The University of Antwerp
                  </a>
                 </strong>
                 has a long-standing tradition in transportation research, performed by the institutions who merged into University of Antwerp in 2003. Academic teaching at the University of Antwerp is closely linked to original scientific research carried out by the University’s academic staff.
                 <br/>
                 The university of Antwerp has 9 faculties. At the Department of Transport and Regional Economics (which is part of the Faculty of business economics), project research plays a key role in gaining scientific knowledge.
                 <br/>
                 The Department aims at a wide array of research projects, incorporating longer term fundamental research projects (FP7 & H2020), as well as contracts with diverse promoters and limited assignments intended for immediate application. Business knowledge also involves to a large extent policy advice, consulting and individual research of the Department members. This way, in the past years, a lot of research was performed for companies, and high-standing research was done into the evaluation of transport investments, mobility policy, tourism, the maritime and port sector, and spatial aspects and city policy. Key staff in participating in the SEAS 4.0 at UA is Dr. Ir. Edwin van Hassel.
                </p>

   <div class="page-header">
    <div class="container">
     <h1 class="entry-title">
      Consortium Organisation
     </h1>
    </div>
   </div>
   <div class="site-content" id="content">
    <div class="container left-sidebar" id="content-inside">
     <div class="content-area" id="primary">
      <main class="site-main" id="main" role="main">
       <article class="post-1413 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-1413">
        <header class="entry-header">
        </header>
        <div class="entry-content">
         <p>
          The administrative organisation of the consortium consists of the:
          <strong>
           Coordinating University
          </strong>
          ,
          <strong>
           Consortium Committee,
          </strong>
          <strong>
           Administartive Board
          </strong>
          ,
          <strong>

          </strong>
          <strong>
           Strategic Advisory Board,
          </strong>
          <strong>
           Student Council
          </strong>
          .
         </p>
         <p>
          All Consortium Universities are jointly engaged in the overall execution and development of the Master Programme and are responsible for the operation of the Master Programme at its own institution.
         </p>
         <p>
          All Consortium Universities will provide qualified staff to deliver the Master Programme and will notify the other Consortium Universities of significant changes in the allocation of staff.
         </p>

   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

   <div class="page-header">
    <div class="container">
     <h1 class="entry-title">
      Administrative Board
     </h1>
    </div>
   </div>
   <div class="site-content" id="content">
    <div class="container left-sidebar" id="content-inside">
     <div class="content-area" id="primary">
      <main class="site-main" id="main" role="main">
       <article class="post-1996 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-1996">
        <header class="entry-header">
        </header>
        <div class="entry-content">
         <p>
          Consists of one administrative representative of each Consortium University and the Coordinator. Each representative is appointed by its respective Consortium University for one year.
         </p>
         <p>
          The Administrative Board provides administrative support to the SEAS 4.0 Programme and works under the guidance of the Master Administrative Coordinator.
         </p>
         <p>
          The Administrative Board will provide the Consortium Committee with a financial and administrative handbook as guideline for all procedures to be followed by the Consortium Universities.
         </p>
        </div>
       </article>
      </main>
     </div>

  <script type="text/javascript">
   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>
