   <div class="page-header">
    <div class="container">
     <h1 class="entry-title">
      Selection Criteria
     </h1>
    </div>
   </div>
   <div class="site-content" id="content">
    <div class="container left-sidebar" id="content-inside">
     <div class="content-area" id="primary">
      <main class="site-main" id="main" role="main">
       <article class="post-1485 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-1485">
        <header class="entry-header">
        </header>
        <div class="entry-content">
         <h4>
          <strong>
           Selection criteria for Erasmus + EMJMD scholarships and other financial supports
          </strong>
         </h4>
         <p>
          The Education Board evaluates the candidates on the basis of the documents uploaded in the online application form and their performances during the interview.
         </p>
         <p>
          Students will be selected first on the basis of academic Excellence, taking their GPA (grade point average) as a major criterion.
          <!-- A motivation letter should also be provided by students willing to apply for the master.-->
         </p>
         <p>
          Working experience is not a compulsory criterion, but it shall be taken into consideration within the procedure selection.
         </p>
         <table style="height: 469px;" width="712">
          <tbody>
           <tr>
            <td width="196">
             <p style="text-align: center;">
              <strong>
               EVALUATION CRITERIA
              </strong>
             </p>
            </td>
            <td style="text-align: center;" width="171">
             <strong>
              EVIDENCE
             </strong>
            </td>
            <td style="text-align: center;" width="129">
             <strong>
              TRANSCRIPTS STAGE
             </strong>
            </td>
            <td style="text-align: center;" width="131">
             <strong>
              INTERVIEW STAGE
             </strong>
            </td>
           </tr>
           <tr>
            <td width="196">
             Academic performance
            </td>
            <td width="171">
             GPA and student transcripts and interview
            </td>
            <td width="129">
             <p style="text-align: center;">
              0 – 30
             </p>
            </td>
            <td width="131">
             <p style="text-align: center;">
              0 – 15
             </p>
            </td>
           </tr>
           <tr>
            <td width="196">
             Academic references
            </td>
            <td width="171">
             Recommendation letters A and B
            </td>
            <td width="129">
             <p style="text-align: center;">
              0 – 10
             </p>
            </td>
            <td width="131">
             <p style="text-align: center;">
              –
             </p>
            </td>
           </tr>
           <tr>
            <td width="196">
             Language level
            </td>
            <td width="171">
             Language certificates
            </td>
            <td width="129">
             <p style="text-align: center;">
              0 – 5
             </p>
            </td>
            <td width="131">
             <p style="text-align: center;">
              0 – 5
             </p>
            </td>
           </tr>
           <tr>
            <td width="196">
             Motivation and fit for the program
            </td>
            <td width="171">
             Motivation letter
            </td>
            <td width="129">
             <p style="text-align: center;">
              0 – 15
             </p>
            </td>
            <td width="131">
             <p style="text-align: center;">
              0 -10
             </p>
            </td>
           </tr>
           <tr>
            <td width="196">
             Multicultural learning environment
            </td>
            <td width="171">
             Personal video
            </td>
            <td width="129">
             <p style="text-align: center;">
              0 – 10
             </p>
            </td>
            <td width="131">
             <p style="text-align: center;">
              –
             </p>
            </td>
           </tr>
          </tbody>
         </table>
         <p>
         </p>
         <p>
          The Selection Procedure develops in two stage: the first stage consists of the analysis of the documentation received by applicants while the second stage is the interview for the selected candidates. At the end of the First stage all the candidates are ranked in order to evaluate their admission to the Interview Stage. Non-eligible candidates and Applicants with the score lower than 50 points are not selected for the interview and they will be informed by mail from the Coordinator.
         </p>
         <p>
          The selected candidates are invited to the interview of maximum 20 minutes duration. During the colloquium, general questions to evaluate the motivation and a few questions relative to candidate professional experience are discussed with the candidate.
         </p>
         <p>
          Applicants obtaining a
          <strong>
           70/100
          </strong>
          minimum score will be ranked and divided into
          <strong>
           MAIN LIST
          </strong>
          and
          <strong>
           RESERVE LIST
          </strong>
          and informed by email before
          <strong>
           March 31
           <sup>
            st
           </sup>
           , 2022.
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p>
          Candidates from the
          <strong>
           MAIN LIST
          </strong>
          will be asked for preliminary acceptance of the EMJMD scholarship before EACEA data control.
         </p>
         <p>
          Candidates that are selected, but not offered a scholarship because of their lower-ranking, are placed on the
          <strong>
           RESERVE LIST
          </strong>
          . They might be offered an EMJMD scholarship if candidates on the MAIN LIST drop out, or if they fail to provide a complete application package before the deadline.
         </p>
         <p>
          Candidates that are on the
          <strong>
           RESERVE LIST
          </strong>
          and that have not been offered a scholarship can apply for a place in the programme as self-funded students.
         </p>
         <p>
          Non-eligible and non-selected Applicants will be notified by email before
          <strong>
           March 31
           <sup>
            st
           </sup>
           , 2022.
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           Promoting Gender Balance in SEAS 4.0
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p>
          SEAS 4.0 is dedicated to promoting gender balance and eliminating the gender gap in technical sciences. The balance between genders will be promoted. In cases of students having the same level and the same qualifications, priority will be given to the less represented gender.
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           Students with Disabilities
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p>
          SEAS 4.0 is dedicated to supporting access to quality education for students with disabilities and encourages differently-abled students to apply for the program.
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           Lifelong Learning
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p>
          SEAS 4.0 supports the commitment of the European Union to lifelong learning and encourages non-traditional, returning, and second-career students to apply.
         </p>
        </div>
       </article>
      </main>
     </div>

					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {

							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );

								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );

					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {

   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

    <div class="container">
     <h1 class="entry-title">
      Selection Results
     </h1>
    </div>
   </div>
   <div class="site-content" id="content">
    <div class="container left-sidebar" id="content-inside">
     <div class="content-area" id="primary">
      <main class="site-main" id="main" role="main">
       <article class="post-1494 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-1494">
        <header class="entry-header">
        </header>
        <div class="entry-content">
         <p>
         </p>
         <p>
          Education Board evaluates the applications according to the selection criteria during March.
         </p>
         <p>
         </p>
         <p>
          Non-eligible and non selected Applicants have been notified by email before
          <strong>
           March 31
           <sup>
            st
           </sup>
           .
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p>
         </p>
         <p>
          Applicants obtaining a
          <strong>
           70/100
          </strong>
          minimum score, are ranked and divided into MAIN LIST and RESERVE LIST and informed by email before
          <strong>
           March 31
           <sup>
            st
           </sup>
           .
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p>
          Candidates from the
          <strong>
           MAIN LIST
          </strong>
          have been asked for preliminary acceptance before EACEA data control.
         </p>
         <p>
          Candidates that are selected, but not offered a scholarship because of their lower-ranking, are placed on the
          <strong>
           RESERVE LIST
          </strong>
          . They might be offered an EMJMD scholarship if candidates on the MAIN LIST drop out, or if they fail to provide a complete application package before the deadline.
         </p>
         <p>
          Candidates that are on the
          <strong>
           RESERVE LIST
          </strong>
          and that have not been offered a scholarship can apply for a place in the programme as self-funded students.
         </p>
         <p>
         </p>
        </div>
       </article>
      </main>
     </div>

   <div class="page-header">
    <div class="container">
     <h1 class="entry-title">
      Appeals
     </h1>
    </div>
   </div>
   <div class="site-content" id="content">
    <div class="container left-sidebar" id="content-inside">
     <div class="content-area" id="primary">
      <main class="site-main" id="main" role="main">
       <article class="post-1490 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-1490">
        <header class="entry-header">
        </header>
        <div class="entry-content">
         <p>
          If the applicant does not agree with the final decision of the SEAS 4.0 then he/she may appeal this decision before the SEAS 4.0 Selection Board.
         </p>
         <p>
          In order to be valid, the appeal must be in writing, using the following
          <strong>
           <a href="https://www.master-seas40.unina.it/wp-content/uploads/2023/11/SEAS-40_Template_APPEAL-AGAINST-SELECTION-DECISION_Intake_24_25.pdf">
            letter template
           </a>
          </strong>
          signed and dated, and sent (in .pdf format) by the applicant to the following address:
          <a href="mailto:begovic@unina.it">
           begovic@unina.it
          </a>
          within seven (7) days following the notification of selection outcome at the latest. Appeals sent after the terms will not be considered.
         </p>
         <p>
          The appeal procedure can only come into play if a candidate feels that the SEAS 4.0 consortium has not handled his own application in line with the scholarship application and selection process as described on the SEAS 4.0 website. In other words, the appeal cannot concern the decision itself, but only an alleged error made in the process.
         </p>
         <p>
          <em>
          </em>
         </p>
         <p>
         </p>
        </div>
       </article>
      </main>
     </div>

					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

   <div class="page-header">
    <div class="container">
     <h1 class="entry-title">
      Student Rights and Obligations
     </h1>
    </div>
   </div>
   <div class="site-content" id="content">
    <div class="container left-sidebar" id="content-inside">
     <div class="content-area" id="primary">
      <main class="site-main" id="main" role="main">
       <article class="post-1492 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-1492">
        <header class="entry-header">
        </header>
        <div class="entry-content">
         <p>
          Once the student applications have been accepted by the EMJMD SEAS 4.0 Consortium Committee, the Consortium Universities enrol these students according to their own regulations where each student will follow at least one semester of the EMJMD SEAS 4.0 master.
         </p>
         <p>
          Enrolment is only official after paying the tuition fee to the account of the Consortium. However, registration always takes place administratively at the Coordinator’s institution.
         </p>
         <p>
          Upon registration, all students are required to sign a
          <strong>
           <a href="https://www.master-seas40.unina.it/wp-content/uploads/2023/11/SEAS-40_Student-Agreement_Partner_Countries_Applicant_Intake_24_25_Template.pdf">
            <u>
             Student Agreement
            </u>
           </a>
          </strong>
          , the content of which is defined by the Consortium Committee, defining their rights and duties.
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           All EMJMD SEAS 4.0 Students are obliged to:
          </strong>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           attend assiduously the prescribed lectures and examinations of the SEAS 4.0 program during the 1.5 academic years with the objective of successfully validating the modules and creating the thesis inherent in the program of studies;
          </li>
          <li>
           participate in the joint activities, such as the workshops, challenge weeks and summer schools even if there is no direct ECTS corresponding to it;
          </li>
          <li>
           attend assiduously the national language course offered in the host institutions even if there is no ECTS corresponding to it;
          </li>
          <li>
           in case of ERASMUS+ scholarship holder the student must not to receive any other scholarship or subvention financed by the EC under other community programs. The student is not allowed to embark on any vocational occupation with a regular salary in parallel to the studies under the ERASMUS+ scholarship excluding internships foreseen as part of the program;
          </li>
          <li>
           to respect the internal rule and charts of the hosting institutions (library, computer chart, etc.);
          </li>
          <li>
           students must ensure that they do not engage in any form of unfair practice, whereby they take action which may result in them obtaining for themselves or others, an unpermitted advantage. Unfair practice is defined as any act whereby a person may obtain for him/herself or for another, an unpermitted advantage;
          </li>
          <li>
           participate in the EMJMD SEAS 4.0 Master Programme course evaluation and Quality Assurance procedures
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
         </p>
        </div>
       </article>
      </main>
     </div>

   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

   <div class="page-header">
    <div class="container">
     <h1 class="entry-title">
      Scholarship
     </h1>
    </div>
   </div>
   <div class="site-content" id="content">
    <div class="container left-sidebar" id="content-inside">
     <div class="content-area" id="primary">
      <main class="site-main" id="main" role="main">
       <article class="post-1096 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-1096">
        <header class="entry-header">
        </header>
        <div class="entry-content">
         <p>
          <strong>
           <a href="http://www.master-seas40.unina.it/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/6.jpg">
            <img alt="" class="wp-image-2519 alignleft" decoding="async" height="448" src="http://www.master-seas40.unina.it/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/6-1024x768.jpg" width="453"/>
           </a>
           PERIODICALLY CONSULT THIS PAGE TO KNOW THE LATEST OPPORTUNITIES
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           Erasmus Mundus scholarships
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           The best 22 applicants (19 from Partner and 3 from Programme Countries) according to selection and eligibility criteria are awarded by EMJMD scholarship.
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           WHICH STUDENTS ARE ELIGIBLE?
           <br/>
          </strong>
          Students from
          <strong>
           all over the world
          </strong>
          are
          <strong>
           eligible
          </strong>
          for an Erasmus+ EMJMD scholarship provided that they fulfil the requirements stated
          <a href="http://www.master-seas40.unina.it/application-and-admission/admission-requirements/">
           here
          </a>
          as well as the additional criteria pointed out in this page.
          <br/>
          Distinction between Programme and Partner countries due to different scholarship amounts awarded (see also the
          <a href="https://ec.europa.eu/info/funding-tenders/opportunities/portal/screen/support/faq;categories=;programme=null;actions=;keyword=EMJMD/10112">
           12-months rule
          </a>
          ):
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           Programme Countries
          </strong>
          include:
          <br/>
          27 EU countries: Belgium, Bulgaria, Czech Republic, Denmark, Germany, Estonia, Ireland, Greece, Spain, France, Croatia, Italy, Cyprus, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Hungary, Malta, Netherlands, Austria, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovenia, Slovakia, Finland, Sweden AND Iceland, Liechtenstein, Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Norway, Turkey Serbia and United Kingdom (as a participating country during the transition period, until 31 December 2020).
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           Partner Countries
          </strong>
          include all other countries.
         </p>
         <p>
         </p>
         <p style="text-align: center;">
          <strong>
           ERASMUS MUNDUS SCHOLARSHIP CALCULATION
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p>
          <img alt="" class="alignnone wp-image-2494 aligncenter" decoding="async" height="457" src="http://www.master-seas40.unina.it/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/CALCULATION_EM_Scholarship-300x142.png" width="965"/>
         </p>
        </div>
       </article>
      </main>
     </div>

					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

   <div class="page-header">
    <div class="container">
     <h1 class="entry-title">
      Students Grants
     </h1>
    </div>
   </div>
   <div class="site-content" id="content">
    <div class="container left-sidebar" id="content-inside">
     <div class="content-area" id="primary">
      <main class="site-main" id="main" role="main">
       <article class="post-1513 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-1513">
        <header class="entry-header">
        </header>
        <div class="entry-content">
         <p>
          <strong>
           ERASMUS MUNDUS
          </strong>
          scholarships are open to higher education Third Country and European students and academics from all over the world. Programmes include obligatory study and research periods, in at least two universities, and award recognised double, multiple or joint degrees.
         </p>
         <p>
          Erasmus Mundus
          <strong>
           scholarship
          </strong>
          covers tuition fees, participation costs (including insurance coverage), travel cost contribution, installation cost contribution, and monthly allowance.
         </p>
         <p>
          Erasmus Mundus scholarships are intended for full-time studies only.
         </p>
         <p>
          Students can apply for an EM scholarship even if they have not yet completed the studies required by the SEAS 4.0 consortium for the joint programme. They must however have completed the relevant degree before the enrolment deadline.
         </p>
         <p>
          Consortium is seeking for additional funding sources available for SEAS 4.0 students. Please, be aware that some requirements may apply (nationality, residence, etc) depending on the funding source.
         </p>
        </div>
       </article>
      </main>
     </div>

   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

    <div class="container">
     <h1 class="entry-title">
      Erasmus Mundus Scholarships
     </h1>
    </div>
   </div>
   <div class="site-content" id="content">
    <div class="container left-sidebar" id="content-inside">
     <div class="content-area" id="primary">
      <main class="site-main" id="main" role="main">
       <article class="post-1509 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-1509">
        <header class="entry-header">
        </header>
        <div class="entry-content">
         <p>
          <strong>
           EMJMD scholarships include:
          </strong>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           the
           <a href="http://www.master-seas40.unina.it/contribution-partecipation/">
            <strong>
             students’ participation costs
            </strong>
           </a>
           (including the tuition fees, full insurance coverage and any other mandatory costs related to the students’ participation in the course),
          </li>
          <li>
           a contribution to
           <a href="http://www.master-seas40.unina.it/contribution-to-student-travel/">
            <strong>
             student travel and installation cost
            </strong>
           </a>
           and
          </li>
          <li>
           a
           <a href="http://www.master-seas40.unina.it/contribution-to-subsistence/">
            <strong>
             subsistence allowance
            </strong>
           </a>
           for the entire duration of the SEAS 4.0 Master’s programme
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <em>
           However, the allowance will be granted following the regulations of the EACEA:
          </em>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           <em>
            scholarship holders studying in their country of residence
            <strong>
             will not receive the subsistence allowance
            </strong>
            during that period;
           </em>
          </li>
          <li>
           <em>
            a scholarship holder from a Partner country
            <strong>
             cannot receive the subsistence allowance for more than 3 months when studying in any Partner country
            </strong>
            .
           </em>
          </li>
         </ul>
        </div>
       </article>
      </main>
     </div>

								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );

   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

   <div class="page-header">
    <div class="container">
     <h1 class="entry-title">
      Scholar Grants
     </h1>
    </div>
   </div>
   <div class="site-content" id="content">
    <div class="container left-sidebar" id="content-inside">
     <div class="content-area" id="primary">
      <main class="site-main" id="main" role="main">
       <article class="post-1524 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-1524">
        <header class="entry-header">
        </header>
        <div class="entry-content">
         <p>
          The Master in Sustainable Ship and Shipping 4.0 provides scholarships for specialized scholars in the fields of study of the master. Specialized Scholars are high achieving researchers with a wide experience in fields related with:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Energy Efficiency and Sustainability (EES)
          </li>
          <li>
           Simulation and modelling (SIM)
          </li>
          <li>
           Information systems and data management (IDM)
          </li>
          <li>
           Robotics & Autonomous Systems (RAS)
          </li>
          <li>
           Polar routes challenges in structure and technology (PR)
          </li>
          <li>
           Ship operation, management and infologistics (SO)
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Scholar/guest lecturers’ mobility is considered eligible in the following cases:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           mobility between the partners of the consortium (including to/from associated partners)
          </li>
          <li>
           mobility from outside the consortium, in case such mobility is clearly linked to the Master course
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Activity programmes can be proposed in any of the Universities participating in the Master:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           University of Naples Federico II, Italy
          </li>
          <li>
           University of A Coruna, Spain
          </li>
          <li>
           University of Zagreb, Croatia
          </li>
          <li>
           Hamburg University of Technology, Germany
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Individual scholarship will be awarded for a week stay (minimum 4 days out of the week end), including travel expenses & accommodation costs. The candidate might stay longer according to convenience but the budget is limited to the amount awarded.
         </p>
         <p>
          Interested candidates should apply through
          <a href="http://www.master-seas40.unina.it/scholar-application-form/">
           <strong>
            online application form
           </strong>
          </a>
          .
         </p>
         <p>
         </p>
         <p>
          The evaluation procedure for the Selection of Applicants will be carried out by the Education Board and will be based on the following criteria, as shown in the table below:
         </p>
         <table>
          <tbody>
           <tr>
            <td width="255">
             EVALUATION CRITERIA
            </td>
            <td width="161">
             EVIDENCE
            </td>
            <td width="104">
             WEIGHT IN SCORE
            </td>
           </tr>
           <tr>
            <td width="255">
             Profile of the Scholar and expertise
            </td>
            <td width="161">
             Scholar CV
            </td>
            <td width="104">
             40
            </td>
           </tr>
           <tr>
            <td width="255">
             Quality of the proposed activity
            </td>
            <td width="161">
             Programme proposed
            </td>
            <td width="104">
             50
            </td>
           </tr>
           <tr>
            <td width="255">
             Fit to the SEAS 4.0 programme
            </td>
            <td width="161">
             Programme proposed
            </td>
            <td width="104">
             10
            </td>
           </tr>
          </tbody>
         </table>
         <p>
          Selected Applicants will receive an Invitation letter from the Education Board with all the details. A final confirmation of its acceptance must be sent back by the Granted Scholar.
         </p>
         <p>
          SEAS 4.0 scholars holding an Erasmus Mundus scholarship must:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Commit themselves to actively participate in the masters course activities
          </li>
          <li>
           Perform teaching/research/student tutoring activities
          </li>
          <li>
           Bring concrete added value to the course and students (through teaching of specific classes, leading and participating in seminars or workshops, monitoring and tutoring student research/project activities, participating in thesis reviews, preparing new teaching modules, etc.)
          </li>
          <li>
           Contribute, after their visiting scholar activities, to the promotion and dissemination of the Erasmus Mundus Programme in general, and the SEAS 4.0 in particular, in their institution and country of origin.
          </li>
          <li>
           Produce a report on the activities carried out during the stay that will be submitted to EACEA.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
         </p>
         <div id="gtx-trans" style="position: absolute; left: 309px; top: 680px;">
          <div class="gtx-trans-icon">
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </article>

				];

       <article class="post-1099 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-1099">
        <header class="entry-header">
        </header>
        <div class="entry-content">
         <p>
          <a href="http://www.master-seas40.unina.it/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/7.jpg">
           <img alt="" class="alignnone wp-image-2660 alignleft" decoding="async" height="188" src="http://www.master-seas40.unina.it/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/For_students-300x147.jpg" width="381"/>
          </a>
          In order to make the most of your student life within a new university, through the visitor’s handbook students will find information about the university structure, suggestions about living and studying in the city as well as useful details for a smooth adjustment to the local community.
         </p>
         <p>
          Further information and assistance can be directly provided by International relation offices of
          <strong>
           SEAS 4.0 Consortium Universities
          </strong>
          .
         </p>

         </p>

   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

   <div class="page-header">
    <div class="container">
     <h1 class="entry-title">
      Insurance
     </h1>
    </div>
   </div>
   <div class="site-content" id="content">
    <div class="container left-sidebar" id="content-inside">
     <div class="content-area" id="primary">
      <main class="site-main" id="main" role="main">
       <article class="post-1548 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-1548">
        <header class="entry-header">
        </header>
        <div class="entry-content">
         <p>
          SEAS 4.0 students are covered by an AON insurance during the whole period of the program.
         </p>
         <p>
          The insurance provided to SEAS 4.0 students is fulfilling the requirements for the Health and Accident Insurance coverage of Erasmus Mundus joint Master degrees.
          <br/>
          <a href="https://wayback.archive-it.org/12090/20210126054520/https://eacea.ec.europa.eu/sites/eacea-site/files/750MB/2020_emjmd_-_annex_ix_health_accident_insurance_-_final.pdf" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
           https://wayback.archive-it.org/12090/20210126054520/https://eacea.ec.europa.eu/sites/eacea-site/files/750MB/2020_emjmd_-_annex_ix_health_accident_insurance_-_final.pdf
          </a>
         </p>
         <p>
          The template of the student insurance  sent to students as soon as the arrival date is communicated to the Coordinator can be seen
          <a href="http://www.master-seas40.unina.it/wp-content/uploads/2022/09/AON-SEAS-4.0-Student-Insurance_template.pdf">
           here
          </a>
          .
         </p>
         <p>
          See the AON presentation for SEAS 4.0 students
          <a href="http://www.master-seas40.unina.it/wp-content/uploads/2022/09/AON_presentation_x_SEAS_4_0_students.pdf">
           here
          </a>
          .
         </p>
        </div>
       </article>
      </main>
     </div>

         <li class="page_item page-item-1099 current_page_ancestor current_page_parent menu-item has_children current-menu-parent current-menu-ancestor">

   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

  <script type="text/javascript">
   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

   <div class="page-header">
    <div class="container">
     <h1 class="entry-title">
      Visas
     </h1>
    </div>
   </div>
   <div class="site-content" id="content">
    <div class="container left-sidebar" id="content-inside">
     <div class="content-area" id="primary">
      <main class="site-main" id="main" role="main">
       <article class="post-1550 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-1550">
        <header class="entry-header">
        </header>
        <div class="entry-content">
         <h3>
          <strong>
           For periods of study over 90 days, Study Visa type “D”
          </strong>
         </h3>
         <h3>
          <strong>
           How do I apply for a visa?
          </strong>
         </h3>
         <p>
          Before applying for a visa for study purposes, we advise you to check the documentation required on the
          <a href="http://www.esteri.it/visti/home_eng.asp">
           Italian Ministry of Foreign Affairs website
          </a>
          .
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://vistoperitalia.esteri.it/home/en">
           https://vistoperitalia.esteri.it/home/en
          </a>
         </p>
         <p>
          Requesting D Type visa for study in Italy has to be done through the
          <a href="https://www.universitaly.it/">
           UNIVERSITALY
          </a>
          web platform where you will indicate University of Naples Federico II as host institution and EMJMD SEAS 4.0. In STEP C of the procedure you will have to upload the following documents:
         </p>
         <ol>
          <li>
           Your passport, the document has to be valid at least for other 3 months after the planned date of exit from Schengen Area,
          </li>
          <li>
           Letter of Admission,
          </li>
          <li>
           Proof of place of residence,
          </li>
          <li>
           Certified copy of the transcript of records of all courses (in English) and of the highest degree obtained,
          </li>
          <li>
           Copy of Language Certificate (not required if you are English native speaker or your previous studies were held in English).
          </li>
         </ol>
         <p>
          After the verification, the University of Naples will notify the local Italian Embassy as indicated by you on the
          <a href="https://www.universitaly.it/index.php/">
           Universitaly.it
          </a>
          web platform.
         </p>
         <p>
          Please, check on
          <a href="https://vistoperitalia.esteri.it/home/en">
           https://vistoperitalia.esteri.it/home/en
          </a>
          where is your nearest Embassy, documents required and administrative costs of the VISA procedure. Please note, that these costs are not covered by the scholarship. For obtaining your VISA it will be generally requested:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           to fill the VISA request form;
          </li>
          <li>
           Passport;
          </li>
          <li>
           Admission Letter from University and a document to proof (the present “Letter of admission to Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree in Sustainable ship and shipping 4.0” could be used to absolve both the aims.)
          </li>
          <li>
           Flight booking and Hotel or Accommodation reservation.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          Please contact directly your Embassy to be informed of additional documents required.
         </p>
         <p>
          If you do not have a document indicating a scholarship or similar, you must show a bank statement of your current account giving your personal details and the details of the Bank. If you share an account with your parents, they need to attach a declaration to their bank statement, stating that they consent to your use of their current account (affidavit). The bank statement must be original. For any further information see the
          <a href="http://www.esteri.it/visti/index_eng.asp">
           Italian Ministry of Foreign Affairs website
          </a>
          .
         </p>
         <h3>
          <strong>
           Schengen Area travel
          </strong>
         </h3>
         <p>
          If you have a Long Stay Visa (Visa Type D, i.e. valid for more than 90 days) and a residence permit, you can travel freely for a period of max 3 months in any 6-month period to the other Schengen states*.
          <br/>
          You are reminded to report your presence to the police authorities in the other Schengen territory within 3 working days of entry.
          <br/>
          *
          <em>
           Schengen States: Austria, Belgium, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Italy, Luxemburg, Netherlands, Portugal, Spain, Sweden, Iceland, Norway, Slovenia, Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, Poland, Czech Republic, Slovakia, Hungary and Malta.
          </em>
         </p>
         <p>
          Source:
          <a href="http://www.esteri.it/visti/index_eng.asp">
           Italian Ministry of Foreign Affairs
          </a>
          ,
          <a href="http://www.interno.gov.it/it/mininterno/export/sites/default/it">
           Ministry of Home Affairs
          </a>
          ,
          <a href="http://www.poliziadistato.it/articolo/10619-English/">
           Italian Police
          </a>
         </p>
         <p>
          Regarding staying in Croatia, further information can be found on
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="http://www.mvep.hr/en/consular-information/visas/visa-requirements-overview/">
           http://www.mvep.hr/en/consular-information/visas/visa-requirements-overview/
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
       </article>

								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {

					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',

     <h1 class="entry-title">
      Students Associations
     </h1>
    </div>
   </div>
   <div class="site-content" id="content">
    <div class="container left-sidebar" id="content-inside">
     <div class="content-area" id="primary">
      <main class="site-main" id="main" role="main">
       <article class="post-2294 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-2294">
        <header class="entry-header">
        </header>
        <div class="entry-content">
         <p>
          <a href="http://www.master-seas40.unina.it/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/8.jpg">
           <img alt="" class="wp-image-2524 aligncenter" decoding="async" height="563" src="http://www.master-seas40.unina.it/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/8-300x245.jpg" width="689"/>
          </a>
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="http://www.master-seas40.unina.it/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/9.jpg">
           <img alt="" class="wp-image-2525 alignleft" decoding="async" height="606" src="http://www.master-seas40.unina.it/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/9-218x300.jpg" width="440"/>
          </a>
         </p>
         <p>
         </p>
         <p>
          When you are about to come, you can find here how to get in touch with students from SEAS 4.0 Consortium Universities: UNINA, UDC and UNIZG.
         </p>
         <p>
          Assist you in direct contact and practical information about life in a new city is our aim. You can find details in “At Consortium Universities” page.
         </p>
         <p>
          This is your network.
         </p>
        </div>
       </article>

   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

     <h1 class="entry-title">
      Erasmus Mundus Association
     </h1>
    </div>
   </div>
   <div class="site-content" id="content">
    <div class="container left-sidebar" id="content-inside">
     <div class="content-area" id="primary">
      <main class="site-main" id="main" role="main">
       <article class="post-2296 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-2296">
        <header class="entry-header">
        </header>
        <div class="entry-content">
         <p>
          The Erasmus Mundus Association (EMA) is an NGO built upon the network for students and alumni of all Erasmus Mundus Joint Degrees (EMJMDs) and Erasmus Mundus Joint Doctorates (EMJDs). EMA was established in 2006 as an initiative of the European Commission. The European Commission remains the main funding body of the Association.
         </p>
         <p>
         </p>
         <p>
          Erasmus Mundus Association
          <br/>
          <a href="http://www.em-a.eu/">
           http://www.em-a.eu
          </a>
         </p>
         <p>
          Erasmus Mundus Association Facebook Page
          <br/>
          <a href="https://www.facebook.com/ErasmusMundusAssociation/">
           https://www.facebook.com/ErasmusMundusAssociation/
          </a>
         </p>
         <p>
          Erasmus Mundus Association Twitter
          <br/>
          <a href="https://twitter.com/Erasmus_Mundus">
           https://twitter.com/Erasmus_Mundus
          </a>
         </p>
         <p>
          Erasmus Mundus Association LinkedIn page
          <br/>
          <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/erasmus-mundus-students-and-alumni-association">
           https://www.linkedin.com/company/erasmus-mundus-students-and-alumni-association
          </a>
         </p>
         <p>
          EMA list of Programme Representatives:
          <br/>
          <a href="http://www.em-a.eu/en/about-ema/programme-representatives.html">
           http://www.em-a.eu/en/about-ema/programme-representatives.html
          </a>
         </p>

					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

   <div class="page-header">
    <div class="container">
     <h1 class="entry-title">
      At Consortium Universities
     </h1>
    </div>
   </div>
   <div class="site-content" id="content">
    <div class="container left-sidebar" id="content-inside">
     <div class="content-area" id="primary">
      <main class="site-main" id="main" role="main">
       <article class="post-2300 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-2300">
        <header class="entry-header">
        </header>
        <div class="entry-content">
         <p>
          <strong>
           At University of Naples Federico II
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="http://www.master-seas40.unina.it/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/Best-Unina.png">
           <img alt="" class="alignnone wp-image-2308" decoding="async" height="154" src="http://www.master-seas40.unina.it/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/Best-Unina.png" width="603"/>
          </a>
         </p>
         <p>
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           BEST
          </strong>
          takes care of training students. Through its
          <strong>
           international network it connects students, universities and companies
          </strong>
          across Europe. Make the most of your college time.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.bestnapoli.org/">
           https://www.bestnapoli.org/
          </a>
          /
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://m.facebook.com/BESTnapoli/?tsid=0.3778060435103643&source=result">
           https://m.facebook.com/BESTnapoli/?tsid=0.3778060435103643&source=result
          </a>
         </p>
         <p>
          ASSI – Associazione degli Studenti di Ingegneria
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="http://www.master-seas40.unina.it/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/Ing-Napoli.png">
           <img alt="" class="alignnone size-medium wp-image-2307" decoding="async" height="168" src="http://www.master-seas40.unina.it/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/Ing-Napoli-300x168.png" width="300"/>
          </a>
         </p>
         <p>
          ASSI is the Association of Engineering Students of the historic University of Naples “Federico II”; It is a non-profit association that aims to promote research on problems and topics and all kinds of initiatives related to student activities, as well as the coordination of all Engineering degree courses.
         </p>
         <p>
          More specifically, we try to:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           support and promote initiatives aimed at the cultural completion of the engineer, connecting him more to the job’s world; continuously monitor the working realities and identify new channels to strengthen engineer’s skills;
          </li>
          <li>
           encourage the creation of groups and/or associations for degree courses which do not have ones, so to discover and solve problems and work for a quick diffusion of right informations and knowledge;
          </li>
          <li>
           identify and develop proposals on the general issues presented by students regardless of the degree courses they belong to;
          </li>
          <li>
           to develop coordination between all students activities, encouraging  relationships and interculturality, the path of student representation, institutions and companies.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.facebook.com/groups/assingegneria/?ref=share">
           https://www.facebook.com/groups/assingegneria/?ref=share
          </a>
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://instagram.com/assingegneria?igshid=1dqst0cdk8n1w">
           https://instagram.com/assingegneria?igshid=1dqst0cdk8n1w
          </a>
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           At University of A  Coruna
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p style="font-weight: 400;">
          AEGEE A Coruna:
          <a href="http://aegeecoruna.udc.es/">
           http://aegeecoruna.udc.es/
          </a>
         </p>
         <p style="font-weight: 400;">
          Erasmus Students Network (ESN) Coruna:
          <a href="https://www.facebook.com/esncoruna">
           https://www.facebook.com/esncoruna
          </a>
         </p>
         <p style="font-weight: 400;">
          Student Association Higher Polytechnic School UDC:
          <a href="https://www.facebook.com/ddaepsferrol/">
           https://www.facebook.com/ddaepsferrol/
          </a>
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           At University of Zagreb
          </strong>
         </p>
         <p>
          https://www.fsb.unizg.hr/index.php?fsbonline&studentske_udruge
         </p>

   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

  <script type="text/javascript">
   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>
